nodes.name: LILYGO
nodes.company: Xin Yuan Electronic Technology Co., Ltd.

files.name: esp32-s3-korvo-1.yaml
files.text:
# esp32-s3-korovo-1 esphome voice-assistant configs
# BUG: Audio is not playing from headphone jack to powered speaker
# Lights react when TTS *should* be playing, but no audio.
substitutions:
  friendly_name: korvo

esphome:
  name: korvo
  friendly_name: korvo
  min_version: 2025.5.0
  platformio_options:
    board_build.flash_mode: dio
  on_boot:
    - priority: -100
      then:
        - logger.log: "Boot started - Initializing audio..."
        - script.execute: init_audio
        - light.turn_on:
            id: led_ring
            effect: power
        - delay: 1s
        - wait_until:
            condition:
              wifi.connected:
        - light.turn_on:
            id: led_ring
            effect: Working
            red: 0%
            blue: 100%
            green: 0%
        - logger.log: "WiFi connected, API connect pending..."
        - wait_until: api.connected
        - logger.log: "API connected to HA!"
        - light.turn_on:
            id: led_ring
            effect: pulse
            red: 0%
            blue: 0%
            green: 100%
        - delay: 1s
        - lambda: |-
            ESP_LOGI("boot", "Boot complete. Heap free: %zu bytes", heap_caps_get_free_size(MALLOC_CAP_DEFAULT));
        - if:
            condition:
              switch.is_on: use_wake_word
            then:
              - voice_assistant.start_continuous:
              - script.execute: reset_led

esp32:
  board: esp32-s3-devkitc-1
  flash_size: 16MB
  cpu_frequency: 240MHz
  framework:
    type: esp-idf
    sdkconfig_options:
      CONFIG_ESP32S3_DEFAULT_CPU_FREQ_240: "y"
      CONFIG_ESP32S3_DATA_CACHE_64KB: "y"
      CONFIG_ESP32S3_DATA_CACHE_LINE_64B: "y"
    version: recommended

psram:
  mode: octal
  speed: 80MHz

output:
  - platform: gpio
    pin: GPIO38
    id: pa_ctrl

external_components:
  - source: github://rpatel3001/esphome@es8311
    components: [ es8311 ]
  - source: github://rpatel3001/esphome@es7210
    components: [ es7210 ]
  - source: github://pr#5230
    components: [ esp_adf ]

logger:
  level: VERY_VERBOSE
  logs:
    esphome: DEBUG
    esphome.components.api: DEBUG
    esphome.components.wifi: DEBUG
    esphome.components.esp32: DEBUG
    esphome.components.voice_assistant: DEBUG
    esphome.components.micro_wake_word: DEBUG
    esphome.components.media_player: DEBUG
    esphome.components.i2s_audio: DEBUG
    esphome.components.speaker: DEBUG
    esphome.components.microphone: DEBUG
    es8311: DEBUG
    es7210: DEBUG
    esphome.components.sensor: DEBUG
    custom: NONE

api:
  encryption:
    key: !secret korvo_password

ota:
  - platform: esphome
    password: !secret korvo_ota

text_sensor:
  - platform: wifi_info
    ip_address:
      name: "${friendly_name} IP Address"

time:
  platform: homeassistant
  id: homeassistant_time

wifi:
  ssid: !secret wifi_ssid
  password: !secret wifi_password

i2c:
  sda: GPIO1
  scl: GPIO2
  scan: true

es8311:
  address: 0x18

es7210:
  address: 0x40

i2s_audio:
  - id: codec
    i2s_lrclk_pin: GPIO41 #ws
    i2s_bclk_pin: GPIO40 #clk
    i2s_mclk_pin: GPIO42
  - id: mic_adc
    i2s_lrclk_pin: GPIO9 #ws
    i2s_bclk_pin: GPIO10 #clk
    i2s_mclk_pin: GPIO20

speaker:
  - platform: i2s_audio
    id: korvo_speaker
    i2s_dout_pin: GPIO39
    dac_type: external
    sample_rate: 16000
    i2s_audio_id: codec

microphone:
  - platform: i2s_audio
    id: external_mic
    adc_type: external
    i2s_audio_id: mic_adc
    i2s_din_pin: GPIO11
    pdm: false

micro_wake_word:
  microphone:
    microphone: external_mic
    channels: 0
    gain_factor: 4
  vad:
  models:
    - model: okay_nabu
      id: okay_nabu_model
    - model: hey_mycroft
      id: hey_mycroft_model

media_player:
  - platform: speaker
    name: None
    id: korvo_media_player
    announcement_pipeline:
      speaker: korvo_speaker
      format: WAV
    codec_support_enabled: true
    buffer_size: 6000
    volume_min: 0.4
    files:
      - id: timer_finished_wave_file
        file: https://github.com/esphome/wake-word-voice-assistants/raw/main/sounds/timer_finished.wav
    on_announcement:
      - if:
          condition:
            - microphone.is_capturing:
          then:
            - logger.log: "stop_wake_word"
            - script.execute: stop_wake_word
      - light.turn_on:
          id: led_ring
          blue: 100%
          red: 0%
          green: 0%
          brightness: 100%
          effect: none
    on_idle:
      - logger.log: "start_wake_word"
      - script.execute: start_wake_word
      - script.execute: reset_led

voice_assistant:
  id: voice_asst
  micro_wake_word: 
  microphone: external_mic
  media_player: korvo_media_player
  noise_suppression_level: 0
  auto_gain: 1dBFS
  use_wake_word: true
  on_listening:
    - light.turn_on:
        id: led_ring
        blue: 100%
        red: 0%
        green: 0%
        brightness: 100%
        effect: wakeword
  on_stt_vad_end:
    - light.turn_on:
        id: led_ring
        blue: 100%
        red: 0%
        green: 0%
        effect: "Fast Pulse"
  on_tts_start:
    - logger.log: "tts_start"
    #- output.turn_on: pa_ctrl
    - delay: 50ms  # Give PA time to power up
    - light.turn_on:
        id: led_ring
        blue: 0%
        red: 0%
        green: 100%
        brightness: 50%
        effect: pulse
  on_end:
    - logger.log: "tts_end"
    #- output.turn_off: pa_ctrl
    - delay: 100ms
    - wait_until:
        condition:
          - not:
              speaker.is_playing:
    - script.execute: reset_led
  on_error:
    - lambda: |-
        ESP_LOGI("voice_error", "Voice error code: %s | Heap: %zu bytes", code.c_str(), heap_caps_get_free_size(MALLOC_CAP_DEFAULT));
    - light.turn_on:
        id: led_ring
        blue: 0%
        red: 100%
        green: 0%
        brightness: 100%
        effect: none
    - delay: 1s
    - script.execute: reset_led
    - script.wait: reset_led
    - lambda: |-
        if (code == "wake-provider-missing" || code == "wake-engine-missing") {
          id(use_wake_word).turn_off();
        }
  on_client_connected:
    - delay: 2s  # Give the api server time to settle
    - script.execute: start_wake_word
  on_client_disconnected:
    - script.execute: stop_wake_word
  on_timer_finished:
    - script.execute: stop_wake_word
    - wait_until:
        condition:
          - not:
              microphone.is_capturing:
    - switch.turn_on: timer_ringing
    - light.turn_on:
        id: led_ring
        red: 0%
        green: 100%
        blue: 0%
        brightness: 100%
        effect: "Fast Pulse"
    - wait_until:
        condition:
          - switch.is_off: timer_ringing
    - light.turn_off: led_ring
    - switch.turn_off: timer_ringing

script:
  - id: init_audio
    then:
      - logger.log: "Initializing PA on GPIO38..."
      - output.turn_on: pa_ctrl
      - logger.log: "PA initialized. Checking audio heap..."
      - lambda: |-
          ESP_LOGI("init_audio", "Heap free after audio init: %zu bytes", heap_caps_get_free_size(MALLOC_CAP_DEFAULT));
  - id: reset_led
    then:
      - if:
          condition:
            - switch.is_on: use_wake_word
            - switch.is_on: use_listen_light
            - switch.is_off: night_mode
          then:
            - light.turn_on:
                id: led_ring
                blue: 100%
                red: 0%
                green: 0%
                brightness: 80%
                effect: none
          else:
            - if:
                condition:
                  - switch.is_on: use_wake_word
                  - switch.is_on: use_listen_light
                  - switch.is_on: night_mode
                then:
                  - light.turn_on:
                      id: led_ring
                      blue: 100%
                      red: 0%
                      green: 0%
                      brightness: 30%
                      effect: none
                else:
                  - light.turn_off: led_ring
  - id: start_wake_word
    then:
      - lambda: |-
          ESP_LOGI("wake_word", "Starting wake word (engine: %s)", id(wake_word_engine_location).state.c_str());
      - if:
          condition:
            and:
              - not:
                  - voice_assistant.is_running:
              - lambda: |-
                  return id(wake_word_engine_location).state == "On device";
          then:
            - lambda: id(voice_asst).set_use_wake_word(false);
            - micro_wake_word.start:
      - if:
          condition:
            and:
              - not:
                  - voice_assistant.is_running:
              - lambda: |-
                  return id(wake_word_engine_location).state == "In Home Assistant";
          then:
            - lambda: id(voice_asst).set_use_wake_word(true);
            - voice_assistant.start_continuous:
  - id: stop_wake_word
    then:
      - logger.log: "Stopping wake word"
      - if:
          condition:
            lambda: |-
              return id(wake_word_engine_location).state == "In Home Assistant";
          then:
            - lambda: id(voice_asst).set_use_wake_word(false);
            - voice_assistant.stop:
      - if:
          condition:
            lambda: |-
              return id(wake_word_engine_location).state == "On device";
          then:
            - micro_wake_word.stop:

switch:
  - platform: template                  # USE WAKE WORD
    name: Use wake word
    id: use_wake_word
    optimistic: true
    restore_mode: RESTORE_DEFAULT_ON
    entity_category: config
    on_turn_on:
      - lambda: id(voice_asst).set_use_wake_word(true);
      - if:
          condition:
            not:
              - voice_assistant.is_running
          then:
            - voice_assistant.start_continuous
      - script.execute: reset_led
    on_turn_off:
      - voice_assistant.stop
      - script.execute: reset_led
  - platform: template                  # USE LISTEN LIGHT
    name: Use Listen Light
    id: use_listen_light
    optimistic: true
    restore_mode: RESTORE_DEFAULT_ON
    entity_category: config
    on_turn_on:
      - script.execute: reset_led
    on_turn_off:
      - script.execute: reset_led
  - platform: template                  # Night Mode Switch
    name: Night Mode Switch
    id: night_mode
    optimistic: true
    restore_mode: RESTORE_DEFAULT_ON
    entity_category: config
    on_turn_on:
      - script.execute: reset_led
    on_turn_off:
      - script.execute: reset_led
  - platform: template
    id: timer_ringing
    optimistic: true
    restore_mode: ALWAYS_OFF
    on_turn_off:
      # Turn off the repeat mode and disable the pause between playlist items
      - lambda: |-
              id(korvo_media_player)
                ->make_call()
                .set_command(media_player::MediaPlayerCommand::MEDIA_PLAYER_COMMAND_REPEAT_OFF)
                .set_announcement(true)
                .perform();
              id(korvo_media_player)->set_playlist_delay_ms(speaker::AudioPipelineType::ANNOUNCEMENT, 0);
      # Stop playing the alarm
      - media_player.stop:
          announcement: true
    on_turn_on:
      # Turn on the repeat mode and pause for 1000 ms between playlist items/repeats
      - lambda: |-
            id(korvo_media_player)
              ->make_call()
              .set_command(media_player::MediaPlayerCommand::MEDIA_PLAYER_COMMAND_REPEAT_ONE)
              .set_announcement(true)
              .perform();
            id(korvo_media_player)->set_playlist_delay_ms(speaker::AudioPipelineType::ANNOUNCEMENT, 1000);
      - media_player.speaker.play_on_device_media_file:
          media_file: timer_finished_wave_file
          announcement: true
      - delay: 15min
      - switch.turn_off: timer_ringing

select:
  - platform: template                  # Wake word engine location
    entity_category: config
    name: Wake word engine location
    id: wake_word_engine_location
    optimistic: true
    restore_value: true
    options:
      - In Home Assistant
      - On device
    initial_option: On device
    on_value:
      - if:
          condition:
            lambda: return x == "In Home Assistant";
          then:
            - micro_wake_word.stop:
            - delay: 500ms
            - lambda: id(voice_asst).set_use_wake_word(true);
            - voice_assistant.start_continuous:
      - if:
          condition:
            lambda: return x == "On device";
          then:
            - lambda: id(voice_asst).set_use_wake_word(false);
            - voice_assistant.stop:
            - delay: 500ms
            - micro_wake_word.start:

light:
  - platform: esp32_rmt_led_strip       # neopixel ring
    id: led_ring
    name: "${friendly_name} Light"
    pin: GPIO19
    num_leds: 12
    gamma_correct: 2.8
    restore_mode: ALWAYS_OFF 
    rgb_order: GRB
    chipset: ws2812
    default_transition_length: 0s
    effects:
      - pulse:
          name: "Pulse"
          transition_length: 0.5s
          update_interval: 0.5s
      - addressable_twinkle:
          name: "Working"
          twinkle_probability: 5%
          progress_interval: 4ms
      - addressable_color_wipe:
          name: "Wakeword"
          colors:
            - red: 0%
              green: 50%
              blue: 0%
              num_leds: 12
          add_led_interval: 40ms
          reverse: false
      - addressable_color_wipe:
          name: "Power"
          colors:
            - red: 100%
              green: 0%
              blue: 0%
              num_leds: 12
          add_led_interval: 50ms
          reverse: false

binary_sensor:
  - platform: template                  # Vol+
    name: "${friendly_name} Volume Up"
    id: btn_volume_up
  - platform: template                  # Vol-
    name: "${friendly_name} Volume Down"
    id: btn_volume_down                 
  - platform: template                  # Set
    name: "${friendly_name} Set"
    id: btn_set
    on_multi_click:
      - timing:
          - ON for at least 50ms
          - OFF for at least 50ms
        then:
          - if:
              condition:
                switch.is_on: timer_ringing
              then:
                - switch.turn_off: timer_ringing
              else:
                - script.execute: start_wake_word
  - platform: template                  # Play
    name: "${friendly_name} Play"
    id: btn_play
  - platform: template                  # Mode
    name: "${friendly_name} Mode"
    id: btn_mode
  - platform: template                  # Record
    name: "${friendly_name} Record"     
    id: btn_record
    on_press:
      - output.turn_on: pa_ctrl
      - voice_assistant.start:
      - light.turn_on:
          id: led_ring
          brightness: 100%
          effect: "Wakeword"
    on_release:
      - voice_assistant.stop:
      - output.turn_off: pa_ctrl
      - light.turn_off:
          id: led_ring

sensor:
  - id: button_adc
    platform: adc
    internal: true
    pin: GPIO8
    attenuation: 12dB
    update_interval: 15ms
    filters:
      - median:
          window_size: 5
          send_every: 5
          send_first_at: 1
      - delta: 0.1
    on_value_range:
      - below: 0.55
        then:
          - binary_sensor.template.publish:
              id: btn_volume_up
              state: ON
      - above: 0.65
        below: 0.92
        then:
          - binary_sensor.template.publish:
              id: btn_volume_down
              state: ON
      - above: 1.02
        below: 1.33
        then:
          - binary_sensor.template.publish:
              id: btn_set
              state: ON
      - above: 1.43
        below: 1.77
        then:
          - binary_sensor.template.publish:
              id: btn_play
              state: ON
      - above: 1.87
        below: 2.15
        then:
          - binary_sensor.template.publish:
              id: btn_mode
              state: ON
      - above: 2.25
        below: 2.56
        then:
          - binary_sensor.template.publish:
              id: btn_record
              state: ON
      - above: 2.8
        then:
          - binary_sensor.template.publish:
              id: btn_volume_up
              state: OFF
          - binary_sensor.template.publish:
              id: btn_volume_down
              state: OFF
          - binary_sensor.template.publish:
              id: btn_set
              state: OFF
          - binary_sensor.template.publish:
              id: btn_play
              state: OFF
          - binary_sensor.template.publish:
              id: btn_mode
              state: OFF
          - binary_sensor.template.publish:
              id: btn_record
              state: OFF

  # Memory monitoring sensors (for debugging crashes/low memory during voice/audio)
  - platform: template
    name: "${friendly_name} Free Heap (8-bit)"
    unit_of_measurement: bytes
    accuracy_decimals: 0
    entity_category: diagnostic
    update_interval: 30s
    lambda: |-
      return heap_caps_get_free_size(MALLOC_CAP_8BIT);

  - platform: template
    name: "${friendly_name} Free IRAM (Internal)"
    unit_of_measurement: bytes
    accuracy_decimals: 0
    entity_category: diagnostic
    update_interval: 30s
    lambda: |-
      return heap_caps_get_free_size(MALLOC_CAP_INTERNAL);

  - platform: template
    name: "${friendly_name} Free PSRAM"
    unit_of_measurement: bytes
    accuracy_decimals: 0
    entity_category: diagnostic
    update_interval: 60s
    lambda: |-
      return heap_caps_get_free_size(MALLOC_CAP_SPIRAM);
    # Returns 0 if PSRAM unavailable; monitors audio model loads (e.g., okay_nabu, TTS buffers)

captive_portal:

web_server:
  port: 80

node.name: 441c3892214413fdcab6343787b17ca0
node.description: Retro Text Effect (Pure CSS)

files.name: retro-text-effect-pure-css.markdown
files.text:
Retro Text Effect (Pure CSS)
----------------------------
I've always loved the 80s design trends, and I wanted to try and recreate this trend using some of the newer CSS properties.

I'm using mask-image, text-stroke, and background-clip CSS properties in this pen, so this may not work properly on some older browsers.

A [Pen](https://codepen.io/thesavant42/pen/ZYGmYdV) by [thesavant42](https://codepen.io/thesavant42) on [CodePen](https://codepen.io).

[License](https://codepen.io/license/pen/ZYGmYdV).

files.name: retro-text-effect-pure-css.markdown
files.text:
Retro Text Effect (Pure CSS)
----------------------------
I've always loved the 80s design trends, and I wanted to try and recreate this trend using some of the newer CSS properties.

I'm using mask-image, text-stroke, and background-clip CSS properties in this pen, so this may not work properly on some older browsers.

A [Pen](https://codepen.io/thesavant42/pen/vEOadgr) by [thesavant42](https://codepen.io/thesavant42) on [CodePen](https://codepen.io).

[License](https://codepen.io/license/pen/vEOadgr).

files.name: style.scss
subs2audacity.py
files.text:
"""
Converts VTT or SRT to Audacity text labels for batch export
"""
import re

# Function to convert timestamp format (HH:MM:SS,MS -> seconds.milliseconds)
def convert_timestamp(ts):
    match = re.match(r'(\d+):(\d+):(\d+)[.,](\d+)', ts)
    if match:
        h, m, s, ms = map(int, match.groups())
        return h * 3600 + m * 60 + s + ms / 1000
    return None

# Function to sanitize labels (truncate and remove problematic characters)
def sanitize_label(text, index, max_length=50):
    text = re.sub(r'[\/:*?"<>|]', '', text)  # Remove invalid filename characters
    text = text.replace("\n", " ")  # Replace newlines with spaces
    text = text.strip()
    if len(text) > max_length:
        text = text[:max_length] + "..."  # Truncate overly long labels
    return f"{index:03d} {text}"  # Add an index number to make labels unique

# Function to parse SRT file
def parse_srt(file_path):
    with open(file_path, "r", encoding="utf-8") as f:
        content = f.read()

    # Match timestamp blocks
    matches = re.findall(r"(\d{2}:\d{2}:\d{2}[.,]\d{3})\s*-->\s*(\d{2}:\d{2}:\d{2}[.,]\d{3})\n(.+?)\n\n", content, re.DOTALL)
    
    # Convert matches into a list of tuples
    timestamps = [(convert_timestamp(start), convert_timestamp(end), text.strip()) for start, end, text in matches]

    return timestamps

# Convert parsed subtitle data to Audacity label format
def convert_to_audacity_labels(subtitle_path, output_path):
    timestamps = parse_srt(subtitle_path)

    # Convert to Audacity label format (start_time, end_time, label)
    audacity_labels = "\n".join([f"{start:.3f}\t{end:.3f}\t{sanitize_label(text, i)}" for i, (start, end, text) in enumerate(timestamps)])

    # Save to file
    with open(output_path, "w", encoding="utf-8") as f:
        f.write(audacity_labels)

# Define output path for Audacity label file
audacity_label_fixed_output_path = "/mnt/data/audacity_labels_fixed.txt"

# Parse and convert the uploaded SRT file with fixes
convert_to_audacity_labels(srt_file_path, audacity_label_fixed_output_path)

# Provide download link
audacity_label_fixed_output_path

node.description: uses readyplayerme avatars + realtime STT/TTS/Voice Cloning + Local AI

node.name: yo-extract
node.description: generate corpus of yodish dialogue from various sources, run analysis

node.name: custom-avatar
node.description: A talking head avatar using SadTalker and visemes for realistic lip-sync and expressive facial animations.

node.name: rhubarb-lip-sync
node.description: Rhubarb Lip Sync is a command-line tool that automatically creates 2D mouth animation from voice recordings. You can use it for characters in computer games, in animated cartoons, or in any other project that requires animating mouths based on existing recordings.
